How Big is Customer Experience Management Software Market?  Customer experience management (CEM) software refers to a computer-based solution used by companies to track and monitor customer reactions. It also assists in gaining valuable feedback using which organizations can take needful actions to improve customer engagement with their brand. Besides this, various technological advancements and the integration of advanced analytics and cloud computing with CEM software are also escalating the product demand. Cadinha & Co. LLC boosted its holdings in shares of Adobe Inc. ( NASDAQ:ADBE – Get Rating ) by 76.1% in the second quarter, according to its most recent filing with the SEC.
The firm owned 1,775 shares of the software company's stock after acquiring an additional 767 shares during the period. Cadinha & Co. LLC's holdings in Adobe were worth $650,000 as of its most recent filing with the SEC.  Other institutional investors have also recently bought and sold shares of the company. Aspiriant LLC grew its holdings in shares of Adobe by 13.7% in the 2nd quarter. Aspiriant LLC now owns 2,798 shares of the software company's stock valued at $1,024,000 after buying an additional 337 shares during the period. Core Alternative Capital grew its holdings in shares of Adobe by 22.1% in the 2nd quarter. Core Alternative Capital now owns 232 shares of the software company's stock valued at $85,000 after buying an additional 42 shares during the period. MUFG Securities EMEA plc grew its holdings in shares of Adobe by 27.9% in the 1st quarter. MUFG Securities EMEA plc now owns 4,563 shares of the software company's stock valued at $2,079,000 after buying an additional 996 shares during the period. US Bancorp DE grew its holdings in shares of Adobe by 11.3% in the 2nd quarter. US Bancorp DE now owns 153,520 shares of the software company's stock valued at $56,196,000 after buying an additional 15,575 shares during the period. Finally, Select Equity Group L.P. acquired a new position in shares of Adobe in the 1st quarter valued at $57,922,000. Institutional investors and hedge funds own 80.75% of the company's stock.  Adobe Stock Performance  Adobe stock traded down $5.42 during trading hours on Monday, hitting $320.26. The company had a trading volume of 31,938 shares, compared to its average volume of 3,608,691. The firm has a 50-day moving average of $327.05 and a 200 day moving average of $375.90. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.25, a current ratio of 1.14 and a quick ratio of 1.14. The firm has a market cap of $148.89 billion, a PE ratio of 31.88, a PEG ratio of 2.29 and a beta of 1.24. Adobe Inc. has a one year low of $274.73 and a one year high of $699.54. Adobe ( NASDAQ:ADBE – Get Rating ) last announced its earnings results on Thursday, September 15th. The software company reported $2.63 earnings per share for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates of $2.65 by ($0.02). The firm had revenue of $4.43 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $4.44 billion. Adobe had a return on equity of 36.49% and a net margin of 28.00%. Adobe's revenue for the quarter was up 12.6% on a year-over-year basis. During the same quarter last year, the business posted $2.65 EPS. On average, sell-side analysts expect that Adobe Inc. will post 11.12 earnings per share for the current year. Analyst Ratings Changes  ADBE has been the subject of several research analyst reports. Evercore ISI decreased their price target on shares of Adobe from $475.00 to $350.00 and set an “outperform” rating for the company in a report on Friday, September 16th. Morgan Stanley reduced their target price on shares of Adobe from $362.00 to $337.00 and set an “equal weight” rating for the company in a research note on Friday, September 16th. Piper Sandler reduced their target price on shares of Adobe from $358.00 to $345.00 and set an “overweight” rating for the company in a research note on Monday, October 17th. Stifel Nicolaus reduced their target price on shares of Adobe from $500.00 to $375.00 and set a “buy” rating for the company in a research note on Friday, September 16th. stories.title: Adobe Inc. (NASDAQ:ADBE) Shares Acquired by Motco

stories.body:
Jornada sin cambios para el Russell 2000, que acabó la sesión del lunes 31 de octubre con una variación del 0%, hasta los 1.846,86 puntos. El Russell 2000 anotó la cifra máxima de 1.854,57 puntos y un volumen mínimo de 1.833,59 puntos. El rango de cotización para el Russell 2000 entre su punto más alto y el más bajo (máximo-mínimo) durante este día se situó en el 1,13%.

En relación a la rentabilidad de los últimos siete días, el Russell 2000 registra un ascenso del 5,63%; pero en términos interanuales mantiene aún una bajada del 19,6%. El Russell 2000 se sitúa un 18,73% por debajo de su máximo del presente año (2.272,56 puntos) y un 11,94% por encima de su valoración mínima del año en curso (1.649,84 puntos).

Un índice bursátil es un indicador que muestra cómo cambia el valor de un determinado conjunto de activos, por lo que toma datos de diferentes compañías o sectores de una parte del mercado.

Estos indicadores son usados principalmente por las bolsas de valores de diversas naciones y cada uno de ellos pueden integrarse por firmas con requisitos concretos como disponer de una capitalización bursátil similar o pertenecer a un mismo tipo de industria, además, hay algunos índices que sólo consideran un puño de acciones para determinar su valor u otras que consideran cientos de acciones.

Los índices bursátiles sirven como indicador de confianza en el mercado de valores, la confianza empresarial, la salud de la economía nacional y global y el rendimiento de las inversiones en acciones y participaciones de una empresa. Si los inversionistas no tienen confianza, los valores de las acciones tendrían tendencia a caer.

Asimismo, funcionan para medir el rendimiento de un gestor de activos y permiten a los inversores tener comparaciones entre la rentabilidad y el riesgo; medir las oportunidades de un activo financiero o crear carteras.

Este tipo de indicadores comenzaron a usarse a finales del siglo XIX luego de que el periodista Charles H. Dow. viera con detenimiento cómo las acciones de las empresas tendían a subir o bajar juntas de precio, por lo que creó dos índices: uno que contenía a las 20 compañías ferroviarias más importantes (pues era la industria más importante de la época), así como 12 acciones de otros tipos de negocios

Actualmente en nuestra economía existen diversos índices y pueden asociarse en función de su geografía, los sectores, el tamaño de las compañías o también el tipo de activo, por ejemplo, el índice estadounidense del Nasdaq está compuesto por las 100 mayores compañías mayormente relacionadas a la tecnologías como Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Facebook (FB), Alphabet (GOOG), Tesla (TSLA), Nvidia (NVDA), PayPal (PYPL), Comcast (CMCSA), Adobe (ADBE).

Cada índice bursátil posee su propia forma de ser medido, pero el principal factor es la capitalización bursátil de cada compañía que lo integra. Este se saca al multiplicar el valor del día del bono en la bolsa correspondiente por el total de participaciones que están en el mercado.

Las empresas que se encuentran en la bolsa de valores están obligadas a presentar un balance de su composición. Dicho informe debe entregarse cada tres o seis meses, según sea el caso.

Leer un índice bursátil también requiere analizar sus variaciones en el tiempo. Los índices actuales siempre arrancan con un valor fijo basado en los precios de las acciones en su fecha de inicio, pero no todos siguen este método. Por ende, puede confundir.

Si un índice ve un incremento de 500 puntos en un día, mientras que otro solo adiciona 20, podría parecer que el primero tuvo un rendimiento mejor. Sin embargo, si el primero comenzó el día en 30.000 puntos y el otro en 300, se puede suponer que, en términos porcentuales, las ganancias para el segundo fueron más destacables.

Entre los principales índices bursátiles de Estados Unidos está el Dow Jones Industrial Average, mejor conocido como Dow Jones, compuesto por 30 compañías. De igual manera, el S&P 500, que incluye a 500 de las mayores empresas de la Bolsa de Nueva York. Por último, hay que mencionar el Nasdaq 100, que vincula a 100 de las mayores firmas no financieras.

Por otro lado, los índices más destacados de Europa son el Eurostoxx 50, que abarca las 50 empresas más importantes de la eurozona. Por otro lado, el DAX 30, principal índice alemán que contiene a las compañías más destacadas de la Bolsa de Fráncfort; la FTSE 100 de la Bolsa de Londres; el CAC 40 de la Bolsa de París; y el IBEX 35, de la bolsa española.

En el continente asiático, tenemos el Nikkei 225, compuesto por las 225 empresas más importantes de la bolsa de valores de Tokio. Se encuentra, además, el SSE Composite Index, es visto como el más representativo de China, conformado por las compañías más relevantes de la Bolsa de Shanghái. El mismo papel que interpretan el Hang Seung Index en Hong Kong y el KOSPI en Corea del Sur.

En lo que respecta a Latinoamérica, se tiene el IPC, que contiene a las 35 firmas más prestigiosas de la Bolsa Mexicana de Valores (BMV). Al menos un tercio de ellas forman parte del patrimonio del magnate Carlos Slim.

Otro es el Bovespa, compuesto por las 50 empresas más importantes de la bolsa de Sao Paulo; el Merval de Argentina; el IPSA de Chile; el MSCI COLCAP de Colombia; el IBC de Caracas, conformado por 6 compañías de Venezuela.

Asimismo, existen otro tipo de índices bursátiles globales como el MSCI Latin America, que incluye las 137 empresas más importantes de Brasil, Chile, Colombia, México y Perú.

De igual forma, está el MSCI World, que incluye a 1600 compañías de 23 países desarrollados; el MSCI Emerging Markets, compuesto por más de 800 empresas de países en desarrollo; y el S&P Global 100, conformado por las 100 firmas multinacionales más poderosas de todo el planeta.

stories.title: Cierre del índice bursátil Russel 2000 este 31 de octubre

en.body:
The 2000 Russell 2000 event, which ended Monday, October 31, with a 0% change, up to 1,846.86 points. Russell 2000 recorded the maximum number of 1,854.57 points and a minimum volume of 1,833.59 points. The rating for Russell 2000 between its highest point and the lowest (maximum) during this day was 1.13%.

In terms of the profitability of the last seven days, Russell 2000 recorded an increase of 5.63%; but in inter-annual terms, it still has a 19.6% drop. Russell 2000 is 18.73% below its maximum of this year (2,272.56 points) and 11.94% above its current minimum year (1.649.84 points).

A stock index is an indicator that shows how the value of a particular set of assets changes, so it takes data from different companies or sectors of a part of the market.

These indicators are used mainly by the stock exchanges of various nations and each of them can be integrated by signatures with specific requirements such as having similar stock-capitalisation or belonging to the same type of industry, and there are also some they want a handful of actions to determine their value or other actions that they consider hundreds of shares.

Stock exchange rates serve as a indicator of confidence in the stock market, business confidence, the health of the national and global economy and the return of investments in a company’s shares and shares. If investors had no confidence, the values of the shares would tend to fall.

They also work to measure the performance of an asset manager and allow investors to have comparisons between profitability and risk; measure the opportunities of a financial asset or create portfolios.

This type of indicator began to be used at the end of the 19th century after journalist Charles H. Dow. was carefully watched as companies’ actions tended to rise or fall price combinations, so it created two indicators: one containing the 20 most important railway companies (because it was the most important industry of the time), as well as 12 shares of other

There are currently various indicators in our economy and can be associated with their geography, sectors, companies’ size or also the type of assets, for example, the American Nasdaq index is composed of the 100 largest companies that are more  nologies such as Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Facebook (FB), Alphabet (GOOG), Tesla (TSLA), Nvidia (NVDA), Paypal (PYPL), Comcast (CMSA), Adobe (ADBE).

Each stock index has its own way of being measured, but the main factor is the stock market capitalisation of each company that integrates it. This is done by multiplying the value of the day of the bonus on the stock exchange for the total of the shares that are on the market.

Companies in the stock exchange are obliged to present a balance of their composition. This report must be delivered every three or six months, as appropriate.

Reading a stock index also requires analysing its variations in time. Current indices always arrive at a fixed value based on the prices of the shares on their starting date, but not everyone follows this method. So you can get confused.

If one index sees an increase of 500 points in one day, while another only adds 20, it might seem that the first one had a better yield. However, if the first one started at 30,000 points and the other in 300, it may be assumed that, in percentage terms, the gains for the second were more significant.

Among the major US stock index is the Dow Jones Industrial Average, best known as Dow Jones, consisting of 30 companies. Similarly, the S&P 500, which includes 500 of the largest companies in the New York Stock Exchange. Finally, we must mention the Nasdaq 100, which links up to 100 of the largest non-financial signatures.

On the other hand, Europe’s most prominent indices are Eurostox 50, which covers the 50 most important companies in the eurozone. On the other hand, the DAX 30, the main German index that contains the most prominent companies in the Frankfurt Stock Exchange; the FTSE 100 of the London Stock Exchange; the CAC 40 of the Paris Stock Exchange; and the IBEX 35, of the Spanish stock exchange.

On the Asian continent, we have the Nikei 225, which consists of the 225 most important companies in the Tokyo stock exchange. The SSE Component Index is also seen as China's most representative, consisting of the most relevant Shanghai Stock Exchange companies. The same role as the Hang Seung Index in Hong Kong and the KOSPI in South Korea.

As far as Latin America is concerned, there is the IPC, which contains the 35 most prestigious signatures of the Mexican Stock Exchange (BMV). At least one third of them are part of the heritage of the magnet Carlos Slim.

Another is the Bovespa, which is made up of the 50 most important companies in the Sao Paulo stock exchange; the Argentina Mercal; the Ipsa of Chile; the MSCI COLCAP of Colombia; the IBC of Caracas, composed of six Venezuelan companies.

There is also another type of global stock exchange rate such as the MSCI Latin America, which includes the 137 most important companies in Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Mexico and Peru.

Similarly, there is the MSCI World, which includes 1,600 companies from 23 developed countries; the MSCI Emerging Markets, consisting of more than 800 companies from developing countries; and the S&P Global 100, consisting of the 100 most powerful multinational firms

stories.title: El Dow Jones termina jornada con descenso de 0,39%

en.body:
The opposite day for the Dow Jones Industrial Average, which ended on Monday, October 31, with lows of 0.39%, up to 32,732.95 points. The Dow Jones Industrial Average reached a maximum volume of 32,883.86 points and a minimum of 32,586.93 points. The rating for the Dow Jones Industrial Average between its highest point and the lowest (maximum) during this day was 0.9%.

In view of the profitability of the last seven days, the Dow Jones Industrial Average has increased by 3.92%, although in the past year it still has a 8.39% drop. The Dow Jones Industrial Average is 11.05% below its maximum year (36,799.65 points) and 13.95% above its minimum annual rate (28.725.51 points).

A stock index is an indicator that measures the evolution of the price of a set of assets, for which it takes data from different companies or sectors of a market segment.

These indicators are mainly used by the stock exchanges of various countries and each of them can be integrated by signatures with specific requirements such as having similar stock-capitalisation or belonging to the same type of industry, and there are also some s which consider only a handful of shares to determine their value or other actions that they consider hundreds of shares.

Stock exchange rates serve as an indicator of confidence in the stock market, business confidence, the health of the national and global economy and the return of investments in an entity’s shares and shares. Generally, if investors do not have confidence, stock prices would tend to fall.

They also work to measure the performance of an asset manager and allow investors to make a comparison between profitability and risk; measure the opportunities of a financial asset or create portfolios.

This type of indicators began to be used at the end of the 19th century after journalist Charles H. Dow. investigate carefully how companies’ actions tend to rise or fall price pairs, so it created two indicators: one containing the 20 most important railway companies (because it was the most important industry of the time), and 12 shares of other types of

There are currently various indicators and can be combined according to their location, sectors, size of companies or asset type, for example, the American Nasdaq index is composed of the 100 largest companies that are most closely related to technologies such as Apple (A , Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Facebook (FB), Alphabet (GOOG), Tesla (TSLA), Nvidia (NVDA), PayPal (PYPL), Comcast (MCSA), Adobe (ADBE).

Each stock index has its own way of calculating, but the main factor is the stock-capitalisation of each firm that integrates it. This is done by multiplying the value of the day of action in the stock exchange for the total number of shares in circulation on the market.

Companies that are in stock are obliged to present a balance of their composition. This report must be released every three or six months, as appropriate.

Reading a stock index also implies warning of changes in time. Current indices always arrive at a fixed value based on the prices of the shares on their starting date, but not everyone follows this method. So you can lead to error.

If one index increases 500 points in one day, while the other only adds 20, it might seem that the first one had a better performance. However, if the first one started at 30,000 points and the other in 300, it can be concluded that, in percentage terms, the profits for the second were considerable.

Among the major US stock index is the Dow Jones Industrial Average, best known as Dow Jones, of which 30 companies are part. The S&P 500, which includes 500 of the largest companies in the New York Stock Exchange. Finally, there is the Nasdaq 100, which is associated with 100 of the largest non-financial signatures.

On the other hand, Europe’s most prominent indices are Eurostox 50, which covers the 50 most important companies in the eurozone. On the other hand, the DAX 30, the main German index that contains the most profitable companies in the Frankfurt Stock Exchange; the FTSE 100 of the London Stock Exchange; the CAC 40 of the Paris Stock Exchange; and the IBEX 35, of the Spanish

In Asia, we have the Nike 225, which is made up of the 225 most important companies in Tokyo's stock exchange. The SSE Component Index is also seen as the main Chinese company, consisting of the most relevant Shanghai Stock Exchange companies. The same role as the Hang Seung Index in Hong Kong and the KOSPI in South Korea.

As far as the Latin American region is concerned, there is the IPC, which contains the 35 most prestigious signatures of the Mexican Stock Exchange (BMV). At least one third of them belong to the capital of the magnet Carlos Slim.

Another is the Bovespa, which is made up of the 50 most important companies in the Sao Paulo stock exchange; the Argentina Mercal; the Ipsa of Chile; the MSCI COLCAP of Colombia; the IBC of Caracas, composed of six Venezuelan companies.

en.title: The Dow Jones is off with a 0.39% drop

stories.body:
Día negativo para el Nasdaq 100, que terminó la sesión del lunes 31 de octubre con descensos del 1,22%, hasta los 11.405,57 puntos. El Nasdaq 100 marcó un máximo de 11.482,99 puntos y un mínimo de 11.331,26 puntos. El rango de cotización para el Nasdaq 100 entre su punto más alto y el más bajo (máximo-mínimo) durante este día se situó en el 1,32%.

Teniendo en cuenta los últimos siete días, el Nasdaq 100 acumula un descenso del 0,22%, de modo que desde hace un año acumula aún una disminución del 27,71%. El Nasdaq 100 se sitúa un 30,88% por debajo de su máximo en lo que va de año (16.501,77 puntos) y un 6,67% por encima de su cotización mínima del año en curso (10.692,06 puntos).

Un índice bursátil es un indicador que deja ver cómo cambia el valor de un un conjunto de activos, para lo cual recolecta datos de distintas empresas o sectores de un fragmento del mercado.

Estos indicadores son usados principalmente por las bolsas de valores de distintos países del mundo y cada uno de ellos pueden integrarse por firmas con características concretas como por ejemplo disponer de una capitalización bursátil similar o pertenecer a un mismo tipo de industria, además, hay algunos índices que sólo consideran un puño de acciones para determinar su valor u otras que consideran cientos de acciones.

Los índices bursátiles sirven como indicador de confianza en el mercado de valores, la confianza empresarial, la salud de la economía nacional y global y el rendimiento de las inversiones en acciones y participaciones de una empresa. Generalmente, si los inversionistas no tienen confianza, los precios de las acciones tendrían tendencia a caer.

Asimismo, funcionan para medir el rendimiento de un gestor de activos y permiten a los inversores poder comparar entre la rentabilidad y el riesgo; medir las oportunidades de un activo financiero o crear carteras.

Este tipo de indicadores comenzaron a utilizarse a finales del siglo XIX luego de que el periodista Charles H. Dow. investigara con detenimiento cómo las acciones de las empresas tendían a subir o bajar juntas de precio, por lo que creó dos índices: uno que contenía a las 20 compañías ferroviarias más importantes (pues era la industria más importante de la época), así como 12 acciones de otros tipos de negocios

Hoy en día en la humanidad existen diversos índices y pueden agremiarse en función de su ubicación geográfica, los sectores, el tamaño de las compañías o el tipo de activo, por ejemplo, el índice estadounidense del Nasdaq está compuesto por las 100 mayores compañías en gran medida relacionadas a la tecnologías como Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Facebook (FB), Alphabet (GOOG), Tesla (TSLA), Nvidia (NVDA), PayPal (PYPL), Comcast (CMCSA), Adobe (ADBE).

Cada índice bursátil posee su propia forma de calcularse, pero el principal factor es la capitalización bursátil de cada firma que lo integra. Este se saca al multiplicar el valor del día del título en la bolsa correspondiente por el total de participaciones que están en en manos de los inversionistas.

Las firmas que aparecen en bolsa están obligadas a presentar un balance de su composición. Dicho reporte debe hacerse público cada tres o seis meses, según corresponda.

Leer un índice bursátil también requiere analizar sus modificaciones en el tiempo. Los índices actuales siempre abren con un valor fijo basado en los precios de los valores en su fecha de inicio, pero no todos siguen este método. Por ende, puede confundir.

Si un índice aumenta 500 puntos en una jornada, mientras que otro solo adiciona 20, podría parecer que el primero tuvo una rentabilidad mejor. Sin embargo, si el primero comenzó el día en 30.000 puntos y el otro en 300, se puede ver que, en términos porcentuales, las ganancias para el segundo fueron considerables.

Entre los principales índices bursátiles estadounidenses está el Dow Jones Industrial Average, mejor conocido como Dow Jones, compuesto por 30 compañías. De igual manera, el S&P 500, que engloba a 500 de las mayores empresas de la Bolsa de Nueva York. Finalmente, viene el Nasdaq 100, que agrupa a 100 de las mayores firmas no financieras.

Por otro lado, los índices más importantes de Europa son el Eurostoxx 50, que abarca las 50 empresas más importantes de la eurozona. También, el DAX 30, principal índice alemán que contiene a las compañías más destacadas de la Bolsa de Fráncfort; la FTSE 100 de la Bolsa de Londres; el CAC 40 de la Bolsa de París; y el IBEX 35, de la bolsa española.

En Asia, los principales índices bursátiles son el Nikkei 225, compuesto por las 225 empresas más importantes de la bolsa de valores de Tokio. Asimismo, el SSE Composite Index, que puede considerarse el más representativo de China, conformado por las compañías más relevantes de la Bolsa de Shanghái. De igual manera, cabe mencionar el Hang Seung Index en Hong Kong y el KOSPI en Corea del Sur.

En lo que respecta a Latinoamérica, se tiene el IPC, que contiene a las 35 firmas más sobresalientes de la Bolsa Mexicana de Valores (BMV). Al menos un tercio de ellas son propiedad del magnate Carlos Slim.

Otro es el Bovespa, compuesto por las 50 empresas más importantes de la bolsa de Sao Paulo; el Merval de Argentina; el IPSA de Chile; el MSCI COLCAP de Colombia; el IBC de Caracas, conformado por 6 compañías de Venezuela.

De igual manera, existen otro tipo de índices bursátiles globales como el MSCI Latin America, que incluye las 137 empresas más importantes de Brasil, Chile, Colombia, México y Perú.

De igual forma, está el MSCI World, que incluye a 1600 compañías de 23 países desarrollados; el MSCI Emerging Markets, compuesto por más de 800 empresas de países en desarrollo; y el S&P Global 100, conformado por las 100 firmas multinacionales más poderosas de todo el planeta.

Stock exchange rates serve as an indicator of confidence in the stock market, business confidence, the health of the national and global economy and the return of investments in a company’s shares and shares. Generally, if investors do not have confidence, the values of the shares would tend to fall.

They also work to measure the performance of an asset manager and allow for a cut between profitability and risk; to measure the opportunities of a financial asset or to create portfolios.

This type of indicator began to be used at the end of the 19th century after journalist Charles H. Dow. carefully observe how the companies’ actions tend to rise or fall price combinations, so it created two indicators: one containing the 20 most important railway companies (because it was the most important industry of the time), as well as 12 shares of other

Today, there are various indicators in our economy and can be combined according to their geographical location, sectors, corporate size or even asset type, for example, the American Nasdaq index is composed of the 100 largest companies that are most closely a technologies such as Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), Amazon (AMZN), Facebook (FB), Alphabet (GOOG), Tesla (TSLA), Nvidia (NVDA), PayPal (PYPL), Comcast (CMSA), Adobe (ADBE).

Each stock index has its own method of calculation, but the main component is the stock-capitalisation of each company that integrates it. This is achieved by multiplying the value of the day of the title in the relevant stock exchange for the total of shares that are in the hands of investors.

Companies that appear on the stock exchange are obliged to present a balance of their composition. This report must be delivered every three or six months, as appropriate.

Reading a stock index also requires careful attention to your changes in time. Current indices always arrive at a fixed value based on the prices of the shares on their starting date, but not everyone follows this method. So you can lead to deception.

If one index grows 500 points in one day, while another only achieves 20, it might seem that the first one had a better performance. However, if the first one started at 30,000 points and the other in 300, it may be that, in percentage terms, the profits for the second were higher.

Among the major US stock index is the Dow Jones Industrial Average, best known as Dow Jones, which is integrated by 30 companies. Similarly, the S&P 500, which includes 500 of the largest companies in the New York Stock Exchange. Finally, there is the Nasdaq 100, which brings together 100 of the largest non-financial signatures.

On the other hand, Europe’s most important indices are Eurostox 50, which covers the 50 most important companies in the eurozone. In addition, the DAX 30, the main German index that contains the most profitable companies in the Frankfurt Stock Exchange; the FTSE 100 of the London Stock Exchange; the CAC 40 of the Paris Stock Exchange; and the IBEX 35, of the Spanish stock exchange.

In Asia, we have the Nike 225, which is made up of the 225 most important companies in Tokyo's stock exchange. The SSE Component Index is also seen as China’s most notable, consisting of the most prominent companies in the Shanghai Stock Exchange. The same role as the Hang Seung Index in Hong Kong and the KOSPI in South Korea.

As far as Latin America is concerned, there is the IPC, which contains the 35 most prestigious signatures of the Mexican Stock Exchange (BMV). At least one third of them are part of the heritage of the magnet Carlos Slim.

Another is the Bovespa, which is made up of the 50 most important companies in the Sao Paulo stock exchange; the Argentina Mercal; the Ipsa of Chile; the MSCI COLCAP of Colombia; the IBC of Caracas, composed of six Venezuelan companies.

There is also another type of global stock exchange rate such as the MSCI Latin America, which includes the 137 most important companies in Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Mexico and Peru.

Similarly, there is the MSCI World, which includes 1,600 companies from 23 developed countries; the MSCI Emerging Markets, consisting of more than 800 companies from developing countries; and the S&P Global 100, consisting of the 100 most powerful multinational firms

How Big is Customer Experience Management Software Market?  Customer experience management (CEM) software refers to a computer-based solution used by companies to track and monitor customer reactions. It also assists in gaining valuable feedback using which organizations can take needful actions to improve customer engagement with their brand. Owing to these benefits and rapid digitization across the globe, CEM software finds extensive applications in retail, healthcare, media and entertainment (M&E), and banking, financial services and insurance (BFSI) sectors. Customer Experience Management Software Market Trends and Drivers:  The increasing adoption of a consumer-centric approach by brands due to the rising competition is one of the key factors driving the market growth. Besides this, various technological advancements and the integration of advanced analytics and cloud computing with CEM software are also escalating the product demand.  Moreover, the growing consumer interaction with multiple platforms like mobile apps, websites, and chats, has increased the need to collect customer reviews on a unified platform. As a result, CEM software is widely utilized to determine and cater to the needs of the customers, which is positively influencing the market growth.
